text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai Kitchen today I 
am making a new and improved video for a dish

that I always turn to if I want something with 
strong bold flavors but I need it quick for like

a weeknight dinner so I am making Pad Prik King 
now Pad means to stir fry prik is chilies and

king is ginger however there's no ginger in this 
recipe and I don't actually know why it's called

Pad Prik King but the legend has it that this 
level of spiciness of this dish is supposed to

be about the same as ginger so it's not supposed 
to be super super spicy but trust me it is so

good let's get started this dish is so simple it 
only has three main ingredients and that is long

beans red curry paste and any kind of protein 
and today I'm using chicken red curry paste you

can use store-bought what I'm using is one that I 
homemade and I like to make my own for this recipe

so I can make it a little less spicy so I can put 
more in it so I get more flavors and chicken about

a centimeter thick when you're doing breasts you 
don't want to cut it so thin because you overcook

them so fast you can also do that I'm I made this 
dish I use size but you know give it a break I use

size all the time so I'm going to give the chicken 
a little bit of an extra flavor by marinating it

in fish sauce and the seasoning for this dish is 
also very simple fish sauce is the only thing you

need and I do this just before I start prepping 
everything it doesn't need to marinate overnight

just you know 15 minutes or whatever just a little 
bit of vegetable oil in here and that's just my

trick so that when I go and put the chicken in 
the pan they spread out easily because otherwise

chicken you know when you put a bunch of meat in 
there and it all clumps up together and you're

spending five minutes trying to spread them all 
out yeah putting a little bit of oil in at this

point will really help at that stage and now the 
herbs I only have one herb for this dish and that

is kaffir lime leaves such an iconic flavor so 
I've got two types the big leaves I'm just going

to tear into chunks just like that I'm going to 
remove the center rib and you're not going to eat

this this is just going to infuse and flavor the 
sauce you can't really chew on this it's like bay

leaves it's not comfy to eat and the other side of 
lime leaves I finally finally Julianne and I did

that just by rolling the leaves up really tight 
and really cut them as fine as you can and this

I'm going to use for garnish on top at the end and 
then other than that I have got some palm sugar so

a little bit more sugar than normal because this 
dish is sort of a balance between sweet and salty

so it is sweeter than your regular stir-fry and 
the next ingredient is something that I didn't use

my last video but I think I don't know why because 
it is so good it makes it so much better this is

salted duck egg and you can get this at Chinese 
grocery stores in the refrigerated section I get

mine already cooked so you can look on the package 
and make sure it says cooked because otherwise you

crack it and it's just going to go all over the 
place but if it's not cooked you just boil it like

you would regular hard-boiled egg hey no big deal 
and you don't want to be sitting and peeling this

because the shells are really brittle after it's 
been salted so you just want to cut right through

it right through said I oh this one has the yolk 
right in the center I like it when that happened

and scoop it out and I love using these Asian 
stainless steel spoon I actually brought these

all the way from Thailand and today now you could 
chop this up and toss it into your stir-fry but

I actually like to serve it on the side so that 
you know people can see it and they can take it

and add it to their stir-fry as they like okay so 
I'm going to start by searing my chicken and you

know me you know I like to do that in this case 
not because I don't want to overcook my chicken

because really it's so fast but because I want to 
get a good sear on the chicken browning is flavor

so it's an optional step you don't have to do it 
but if you do do it it just adds a little extra

flavor so I'm doing this in batches because my 
pan is not wide enough to do all of it if I crowd

the pan I'm not going to get a good sear either 
and then don't touch it it for like a minute or

so because if you keep moving around and stirring 
it you're not going to get that browning because

it needs that contact time get really hot and 
brown and it will spatter so these mesh things

are really useful okay so now I'm going to check 
yep I've got nice earrings just going to give it

a quick toss and I don't need to really sear 
the other side I just need to sort of get the

other side spin my cooks remove my chicken from 
the pan okay I'm going to let my pan cool down

a little bit because right now it's really really 
hot and the next thing we're going to do is saute

the curry paste and curry paste it's made of 
fresh herbs it could burn really quickly okay

but my pan is cooled down a little bit I'm going 
to add some oil and you want to be a little bit

generous with oil because you're trying to saute 
curry paste and you add a tiny a little bit your

curry paste will be clumpy I'm going to add 
the curry paste my pan is still not on and I'm

using quite a lot I made this curry paste myself 
and I made it less spicy so I know I can really

get all that flavor in there without it being too 
spicy just spread it out a little bit there we go

so now it's a little bit it's not clumpy anymore 
I'm going to turn my heat on just medium and I'm

going to get that cooking and once it starts to 
sizzle I'm going to go in with my sugar because

my sugar is hard and I've got some clumps in there 
so I want to make sure that it really has time to

dissolve and now it's starting to clump because 
they're the curry paste is dried up a little bit

I've got some chicken stock right here I'm going 
to deglaze and this will help the sugar dissolve

and if you're using stock and not water you're 
also adding flavor my kaffir lime leaves the ones

that I've torn up and that's going to infuse into 
the sauce and if your sauce is dried up and your

sugar is still clumpy you can just add a little 
more stock mmm oh this should make your house

smell really good I'm going to add my fish sauce 
the only seasoning in here now how much fish sauce

you need completely depends on the saltiness of 
your curry paste so make sure if it's the first

time add just a little bit maybe just one teaspoon 
and then taste and adjust at the end oh it's

darkening now that's all that sugar dissolving 
add a little bit of stock I'm going to go in with

my chicken and you want the sauce to be a little 
bit runny because it's really thick you'll have a

hard time getting it to coat the chicken in goes 
the chicken and now you want to get the chicken

completely cooked at this point and this recipe 
will spatter a lot so you know it's just something

you have to live with all right long beans going 
in my chicken is about 80% done I don't want to

cook my long beans very long at all just 1 minute 
so that they're still crunchy all right I'm going

to turn that off whoo lots of spattering so I 
really should have worn an apron but there's a

reason why I wore dark colored shirt today because 
I knew this was going to happen okay you want this

to be quite dry so this is not a dish with lots of 
sauce pooling you want all that curry paste really

cling on to the chicken and the beans now we're 
gonna have this with some rice finely julienned

kaffir lime leaves that we served saved earlier 
I'm going to put my salted egg right here as a

garnish well it's not a garnish it's something you 
should definitely eat alongside your Patrick King

you want some hot jasmine rice with this because 
this is gonna have a really strong flavor you

don't want to eat that on its own some salted egg 
and since it's just me I'll take a whole half the

salted egg is some potent stuff so you don't want 
to you know a big bite of it just a little bit

it's such a great mix of textures and flavors 
the beans are crunchy the chicken is tender

and the egg is creamy and then there's that 
salty sweet balance from the slightly sweet

stir-fry and that's salty punch from the 
egg up so good and that was so easy it was

literally like six ingredients or something 
like that so I hope you give this a try I

promise you you will return to it again and 
again because it's so good it's so easy so

the recipe is as always on Hawkeye chicken 
calm when you make it send me a photo on

Facebook Twitter and Instagram I love seeing 
your photos make sure you subscribe to the

show so you never miss an episode and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious tiny
